title: Constructivist Design Practice for ICT-Integrated Social Education

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Focuses on cultivating problem-solving skills for societal issues using ICT in professional fields (medical/legal/technical) where learners are professionals

learning_goals: Learners will be able to design a project analyzing the causal relationships of social phenomena using ICT tools based on a constructivist approach.
Learners will be able to propose an ICT-integrated lesson design considering the interaction between technology, interaction, and instructional methods, and establish valid evaluation criteria.
Learners will be able to collaboratively create solutions for social issues using online collaboration tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Workspace) via digital devices (tablets/laptops).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
